p: Some substrates mimic the inhibitors of influenza virus neuraminidase, for example, the thioglycoside, 3-deoxy-3-fluoro derivative and phosphonate of sialic acid (Neu5Ac), whereas the 2-deoxy-2,3-didehydro- N-acetylneuraminic acid (Neu5Ac2en, DANA) was identified as the first effective neuraminidase inhibitor (K i = 4 × 10 −6 M) which mimics the transition state in the enzymatic cleavage of the sialo-moiety.
